channel.title: Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics Blog

item.title: Book Updates and Table of Contents
item.description: Book Updates and Complete Table of Contents
item.content:encoded:
Book Updates and Complete Table of Contents​

We're excited to share the latest updates and improvements to our comprehensive guide on Physical AI and humanoid robotics. This book continues to evolve with new content, examples, and insights into the rapidly advancing field of robotics.

Recent Additions​

  • Enhanced coverage of Vision-Language-Action systems
  • Updated examples for the latest ROS 2 distributions
  • New case studies on humanoid robot implementations
  • Expanded appendices with additional resources

Complete Table of Contents​

Core Modules​

  1. Introduction to Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics

    • Understanding the scope and applications
    • Overview of key concepts and technologies

  2. Module 1: ROS 2 Fundamentals

    • Robot Operating System 2 basics
    • Node communication and message passing
    • Package management and launch files

  3. Module 2: Digital Twin Simulation

    • Gazebo and Unity simulation environments
    • Robot modeling and physics simulation
    • Sensor integration and testing

  4. Module 3: AI-Robot Brain (NVIDIA Isaac)

    • Perception and computer vision
    • Navigation and path planning
    • AI-driven decision making

  5. Module 4: Vision-Language-Action (VLA)

    • Integrating perception and language
    • Action execution and control
    • Human-robot interaction

  6. Capstone Project

    • Building a complete humanoid AI system
    • Integration of all learned concepts
    • Testing and validation procedures

  7. Appendices

    • ROS 2 cheat sheets
    • Isaac API references
    • Troubleshooting guides
    • Glossary of terms

Coming Soon​

  • Advanced control algorithms
  • Multi-robot coordination
  • Ethical considerations in humanoid robotics
  • Industrial applications and case studies

Stay tuned for more updates, new content, and exciting developments in the world of Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics!
